He is not altogether a fool. Well, how does he set about it? He goes boldly to the village chemist's and purchases strychnine under his own name, with a trumped up story about a dog which is bound to be proved absurd. He does not employ the poison that night. No, he waits until he has had a violent quarrel with her, of which the whole household is cognisant, and which naturally directs their suspicions upon him. He prepares no defence   no shadow of an alibi, yet he knows the chemist's assistant must necessarily come forward with the facts. Bah! Do not ask me to believe that any man could be so idiotic! 2028.passage:
She admits to [MASK],    I don't know what to do; scandal between husband and wife is a dreadful thing.' At four o'clock she has been angry, but completely mistress of herself. At five o'clock she is in violent distress, and speaks of having had a great shock.

"Looking at the matter psychologically, I drew one deduction which I was convinced was correct.

2029.passage:
At five o'clock she is in violent distress, and speaks of having had a great shock.

"Looking at the matter psychologically, I drew one deduction which I was convinced was correct. The second    scandal' she spoke of was not the same as the first   and it concerned herself!

"Let us reconstruct. At four o'clock, [MASK] quarrels with her son, and threatens to denounce him to his wife   who, by the way, overheard the greater part of the conversation.

2031.passage:
What was that something?

"As far as we know, she was quite alone during that half-hour. Nobody entered or left that boudoir. What then occasioned this sudden change of sentiment?

"One can only guess, but I believe my guess to be correct. [MASK] had no stamps in her desk.

2051.passage:
I see everything now," said [MASK]. "The drugged cocoa, taken on top of the poisoned coffee, amply accounts for the delay."

"Exactly.

2056.passage:
Her medicine!"

"Do you mean that the murderer introduced the strychnine into her tonic?" [MASK] cried.

2073.passage:
I think that I have more diplomacy than you give me credit for."

"My friend," besought [MASK], "I implore you, do not enrage yourself! Your help has been of the most invaluable.

2076.passage:
Well," [MASK] grumbled, a little mollified. "I still think you might have given me a hint."

"But I did, my friend.

2099.passage:
They are a clever pair!"

"I am still a little fogged as to how exactly the bromide business was done," [MASK] remarked.

"_Bon!_

2154.passage:
It must, in fact, have been distinctly annoying to the pair of schemers."

"His manner was unfortunate," [MASK] observed thoughtfully.

"Yes.

2211.passage:
And neither of them is for you?" finished [MASK]. "Never mind. Console yourself, my friend. We may hunt together again, who knows? And then      "


THE END
